components.html: Form elements marked with a red asterisk (*) are required to submit the completed chain of custody. Fields marked with (required) are necessary for the lab to complete the data upload but can be completed in the field with pen and paper if they are not known beforehand. These fields are also underlined in the final PDF.
components.label: Text/Images
Project (required)
components.tooltip: Projects are used to keep track of whom to invoice for a sampling field visit. In EnMoDS projects are also used to find data, each field visit and all of data from it are assigned to a single project which can be searched upon.
components.description: Select a project associated with this sampling field visit. Results will be associated with this project and the project will be used for billing purposes.

components.label: Sampling Agency (required)
components.description: Select the agency or group carrying out this field trip.

components.label: Laboratory (required)
components.tooltip: The laboratory which you are sending these samples to. If it is ALS they will also have access to this digital CoC once you click submit at the end.
components.description: Select the laboratory you will be sending the samples to.

components.label: Panel
components.title: Ministry Contact
components.tooltip: The ministry contact is responsible for answering any questions about this CoC that the analyzing lab might have. They are also responsible to ensure that all data requested is entered correctly and completely into EnMoDS. Once they have finished checking the data for correctness, they should mark the data status as reviewed.

components.label: Phone Number (required)
components.description: Enter your work phone number.

components.label: Location ID (required)
components.tooltip: Select the location you plan to visit for sampling. If you do not know where you will be sampling you can enter the location ID (formally known as EMS ID) in the field.
components.description: Select the location you are going to sample at.

components.label: Location ID (required)
components.description: Enter the location ID and location name as free text here if and only if you cannot find the location in the first drop down. For data upload to work the location ID must already exist within EnMoDS.

components.label: locationId1
Test Display of location ID and Name
Panel
components.title: Complete in the field
components.tooltip: These boxes can be filled in on paper in the field if not known.

components.label: Field visit start date and time (required)
components.tooltip: If you want to have the date filled in on your printed PDF or paper form and add the exacct time in the field enter the time here as 00:00.
components.description: Enter the date and time you arrived at the sampling location.

components.label: fieldVisitStartDateAndTime
Field visit end date and time
components.description: Enter the date and time you left the sampling location.

components.label: fieldVisitEndDateAndTime
Participants
components.description: Enter the field visit participants if known.

components.label: Comments
components.description: Any comments about the field visit.

components.label: QC Type (required)
components.tooltip: Select the quality control type for this sample. Hover text is available for each option.

defaultValue.name: Normal
defaultValue.description: A regular sample that is not of any particular quality control type.

components.label: Collection Method (required)
components.tooltip: The type of collection method used.

defaultValue.name: A discrete sampling method. Depending on what is being sampled, grab samples may be collected by simply dipping a sample bottle in a water body, or they may require the use of other specific sampling devices.

components.label: Medium (required)
components.tooltip: Select the sample medium (matrix) which best describes your planned sampling.

components.label: fieldActivityName
Sample Start Date and Time (required)
components.tooltip: If you want to have the date filled in on your printed PDF or paper form and add the exacct time in the field enter the time here as 00:00.
components.description: The date and time the sample collection started.

components.label: sampleStartDateAndTime
Upper Depth (m)
components.description: If the sample was collected over a range of depths enter the upper most depth here. If the sample was collected at only one depth enter that depth here.

components.label: Sample End Date and Time
components.description: The date and time sample collection ended.

components.label: sampleEndDateAndTime
Lower Depth (m)
components.description: If a sample was collected over a range of depths this is the lower most depth.

components.label: Comments
components.description: Any comments about this sample.

components.label: Specimen
components.tooltip: A specimen is one level above result observations and is typically an individual bottle, jar, or bag.

components.label: Specimen Name
components.tooltip: Specimen name can be whatever you want but you cannot reuse the same specimen name multiple times on a single CoC.
components.description: Enter the specimen name as you want it to display in the database and to the lab.

components.label: Analytical Package
components.tooltip: The analytical group is the analysis package being requested for this specimen. Analytical groups have recommended bottle size, field filter instructions, and preservatives. If you have a special analysis select 'Other'.
components.description: Select the analytical package for this specimen.

components.label: Observed Property
components.description: Select one or multiple observed properties for which you want analytical results.

components.label: List Specific Test(s) Here
components.description: If you are ordering specific tests not listed in the Analytical Groups menu above enter them here.

components.label: Bottle
components.tooltip: This is the suggested bottle type. Use professional judgment as needed.
components.description: Recommended bottle size and type.

components.label: Field Filter
components.tooltip: This field auto-populates based on the selected analytical group but can be overwritten if needed.

components.label: Preservative
components.tooltip: This field auto-populates based on the selected analytical group but can be overwritten if necessary.

components.label: Comments
components.description: Any comments about this sample.

sampleCollectionMethod.name: A discrete sampling method. Depending on what is being sampled, grab samples may be collected by simply dipping a sample bottle in a water body, or they may require the use of other specific sampling devices.

components.label: Submit
components.tooltip: Once you click submit you will no longer be able to edit your CoC. Save as a draft if you want to come back and make future changes.
components.description: Once you click submit you will no longer be able to edit your CoC.
